intro: Oyedaea cuerviana, commonly known as the Cuerviana orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Central America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant blooms. The plant typically grows on tree trunks or branches, exhibiting an epiphytic growth habit. Its leaves are elongated and革质, while its flowers are usually pink or purple in color. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a threatened species.
